data.taskTitle: Fix /tasks project header showing wrong agent count
Fix /tasks project header showing wrong agent count
data.approach: Investigate why project header shows 2 active but only 1 agent is visible. Check how ACTIVE TASKS count is computed vs how agents are displayed. The issue likely involves how epics vs standalone tasks count toward the active badge.

data.taskTitle: Fix /tasks project header showing agents hidden in collapsed epic groups
summary: Auto-expand epic groups in ACTIVE TASKS that have active sessions
Previously only standalone group was expanded by default, hiding agents under collapsed epics
Users now see all active agents immediately without needing to manually expand epic groups
reviewFocus: Verify epic groups with active sessions expand on initial page load

summary: Investigated discrepancy between /tasks project header row agent display

quality.preExisting: Unclear agent configuration in tasks project view

suggestedTasks.title: Resolve Multi-Agent Display Inconsistency in Tasks View
suggestedTasks.description:
Investigate and fix why only one agent is showing in the /tasks project header when multiple agents should be visible. Examine the rendering logic in the CLI component responsible for agent display and ensure all associated agents are correctly populated and rendered.

Verify data sources, check for potential filtering issues, and validate agent assignment mechanisms.
suggestedTasks.reason: Header row agent display does not match actual agent configuration

suggestedTasks.title: Document Agent Display Configuration Rules
suggestedTasks.description:
Create comprehensive documentation explaining how agents are assigned and displayed in the tasks project view. Include clear guidelines on multi-agent configurations, potential edge cases, and troubleshooting steps for developers encountering similar display inconsistencies.

Target documentation should cover the specific CLI components and configuration mechanisms.
suggestedTasks.reason: Current configuration is confusing and lacks clear documentation

gotchas: Potential rendering discrepancies in multi-agent scenarios
